text: {{Infobox settlement |name = Imbabura |official_name = Province of Imbabura |other_name = |native_name = |nickname = |settlement_type = Province |total_type = |motto = |image_skyline = Imbabura des del sud.JPG |imagesize = |image_caption = Mount Imbabura from south-east. |image_flag = Bandera Provincia Imbabura.svg |flag_size = |image_seal = |seal_size = |image_shield = |shield_size = |image_blank_emblem = |blank_emblem_type = |blank_emblem_size = |image_map = Ecuador Imbabura province.svg |mapsize = |map_caption = Imbabura Province in Ecuador |image_map1 = Cantones de Imbabura.png |mapsize1 = |map_caption1 = Cantons of Imbabura Province |image_dot_map = |dot_mapsize = |dot_map_caption = |dot_x = |dot_y = |pushpin_map = |pushpin_label_position = |pushpin_map_caption = |pushpin_mapsize = |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = |seat_type = Capital |seat = Ibarra |parts_type = Cantons |parts_style = coll |parts = |p1 = |p2 = |p3 = |p4 = |p5 = |p6 = |p7 = |p8 = |government_footnotes = |government_type = |leader_title = Provincial Prefect |leader_name = Diego García |established_title = Settled |established_date = |established_title1 = Legal establishment |established_date1 = |named_for = |area_magnitude = |unit_pref = |area_footnotes = |area_total_km2 = 4587.51 |area_land_km2 = |area_water_km2 = |area_total_sq_mi = |area_land_sq_mi = |area_water_sq_mi = |area_water_percent = |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = |elevation_ft = |elevation_max_m = |elevation_max_ft = |elevation_min_m = |elevation_min_ft = |population_as_of = 2010 census |population_footnotes = |population_note = |population_total = 398244 |population_density_km2 = auto |population_density_sq_mi = |timezone = ECT |utc_offset = |timezone_DST = |utc_offset_DST = |blank_name_sec2 = HDI (2017) |blank_info_sec2 = 0.747 · 7th |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = |registration_plate = I |website = |footnotes = }} Imbabura () is a province located in the Andes of northern Ecuador. The capital is Ibarra. The people of the province speak Spanish and the Imbaburan Quechua language. The summit of Cotacachi Volcano at an elevation of is north-east of the town of Cotacachi. == Cantons == The province is divided into six cantons. The following table lists each with its population at the 2010 census, its area in square kilometres (km²), and the name of the capital.Cantons of Ecuador. Statoids.com. Retrieved 4 November 2009. Canton Pop.
